Employee.title: Employee
Employee.description: Represents an employee in the HR Pulse system.

id.description: Unique identifier for the employee, typically a Firestore-generated ID.

employeeId.description: Employee ID, might be different from the unique 'id'.

password.description: Password for the employee's account, stored in Firestore.

contractType.description: Type of contract the employee has (e.g., full-time, part-time).

customCheckInTime.description: Custom check-in time for part-time employees (e.g., '10:00').

customCheckOutTime.description: Custom check-out time for part-time employees (e.g., '16:00').

hireDate.description: Date when the employee was hired.

status.description: Current status of the employee (e.g., active, inactive).

deviceVerificationEnabled.description: Whether to enforce device ID verification for this employee.

deviceId.description: The unique device ID registered for this employee.

Allowance.title: Allowance
Allowance.description: Represents an allowance for an employee.

name.description: Name of the allowance (e.g., housing allowance, transportation allowance).

WorkDay.title: WorkDay
WorkDay.description: Represents a workday and attendance information for employees.

checkInTime.description: Time when the employee checked in.

checkOutTime.description: Time when the employee checked out.

totalWorkHours.description: Total work hours for the day.

DeductionPolicy.title: DeductionPolicy
DeductionPolicy.description: Represents a deduction policy for delays, absences, and early departures.

id.description: Unique identifier for the deduction policy.

gracePeriodMinutes.description: Grace period in minutes before delay deductions apply.

delayDeductionRate.description: Deduction rate for delays (e.g., every 15 minutes of delay = 1 hour deduction).

Payroll.title: Payroll
Payroll.description: Represents a payroll record for an employee for a specific month.

id.description: Unique identifier for the payroll record.

month.description: Month for which the payroll is calculated.

year.description: Year for which the payroll is calculated.

netSalary.description: Net salary for the employee (basic salary + allowances + overtime pay - deductions).

QrCode.title: QrCode
QrCode.description: Represents a QR code generated for attendance tracking.

id.description: Unique identifier for the QR code.

sessionId.description: Session ID associated with the QR code.

date.description: Date when the QR code was generated.

token.description: Secret token associated with the QR code for security.

validUntil.description: Expiration date/time for the QR code.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to automate HR operations with a focus on attendance tracking and payroll management. The design prioritizes authorization independence and follows the DBAC principle, storing roles implicitly based on collection membership. The structure uses path-based ownership for user-related data (employees) and denormalization where needed to avoid `get()` calls in security rules.

*   **/employees/{employeeId}**: Stores employee information. Used path-based ownership which simplifies security rules related to employee-specific data. Employee IDs are used for secure access to their own records.
*   **/workDays/{workDayId}**: Stores daily attendance data for each employee in a single collection. This simplifies querying for all attendance records or filtering by day.
*   **/deductionPolicies/{deductionPolicyId}**: Stores deduction policies. The lack of inherent user relationships here suggests a global scope, meaning the DBAC (database-enforced access control) approach can be applied by granting access through collection existence checks (e.g., `/roles_admin/{uid}`).
*   **/payrolls/{year}/{month}/{employeeId}**: Stores payroll records for each employee per month. Path-based ownership based on employee ID ensures that only the employee or authorized personnel (determined through roles) can access payroll information.
*   **/qrCodes/{qrCodeId}**: Stores QR code data for attendance tracking. Data includes session ID, date, type, token, and validity period. The security model prevents fake attendance by linking the QR code to a specific session and employee, enforced by Firebase Security Rules. Each QR code is valid for a short duration.
*   **/roles_admin/{uid}**: Collection used to store admin roles. Document existence determines admin privileges.
*   **/roles_hr/{uid}**: Collection used to store HR roles. Document existence determines HR privileges.

This structure provides Authorization Independence by denormalizing authorization context. For example, access to an employee's `workDays` or `payrolls` is determined by the employee ID in the path, not by fetching data from the parent `employee` document. This eliminates the need for `get()` calls in security rules.

The structure also supports the required QAPs:

*   **Secure List Operations:** Segregation of data into collections with homogeneous security postures enables secure `list` operations. For example, listing all employees is secure because all documents in the `/employees` collection have the same access control requirements.
*   **Role-Based Access Control:** Roles are managed using dedicated collections (`roles_admin`, `roles_hr`). The security rules can check for the existence of a document in these collections to grant access to sensitive operations.
